recipes.title: Broccoli Stir Fry
recipes.instructions: Blanch broccoli in salted, oiled boiling water; shock in ice bath and drain. Stir-fry aromatics in hot oil, add broccoli, Shaoxing wine, then pour in premixed sauce (salt, sugar, chicken bouillon, cornstarch, water, oyster sauce); toss until glossy and thickened.

recipes.title: Butter Chicken
recipes.instructions: Sear marinated chicken in ghee; set aside. In same pan cook onion, salt, garlic, ginger until softened. Add garam masala, Kashmiri chili, turmeric, fenugreek, sugar; cook until fragrant. Add crushed tomatoes, reduce briefly, blend smooth; return sauce and chicken to pan and simmer 7 minutes. Add heavy cream; simmer 7 minutes. Cut heat, stir in butter; salt to taste.

recipes.title: Gochujang Stew (고추장찌개)
recipes.instructions: Slice zucchini. Slice radish, onion, green onion, chili peppers, and mushrooms. Slice pork and season with black pepper. In a pot, add cooking oil and stir-fry pork with black pepper until cooked through; add red chili powder and bloom on low heat. Add water and gochujang; bring to a boil. Add soup soy sauce, tuna extract (optional), sugar, and minced garlic; mix well. Add radish, onion, potato, and mushrooms; simmer until radish is soft and flavors blend. Finish with zucchini and chili peppers; simmer briefly and serve hot.

recipes.title: Pork Stir Fry (제육볶음)
recipes.instructions: Mix marinade (gochujang, gochugaru, soy sauce, sugar, honey, sesame oil, minced garlic, grated ginger, mirin). Add pork and marinate 30 minutes (or a few hours). Heat oil in a pan over medium-high. Add marinated pork; stir-fry until mostly cooked. Add onion, carrot, and garlic; stir-fry until vegetables are tender and pork is cooked through. Add green onions; stir 1 minute. Drizzle a little sesame oil and black pepper to taste. Serve with steamed rice.

recipes.title: Mongolian Beef
recipes.instructions: Prep bowls: B1 cornstarch + white pepper + salt; B2 ginger + fresno chiles + gochugaru; B3 brown sugar; B4 dark soy + soy sauce + water + rice vinegar; B5 Thai basil + garlic; B6 flank steak sliced 1/2 inch. Heat peanut oil in wok. Toss beef in B1; shallow‑fry until browned; set aside. Sear green onions ~1 minute until caramelized. Add B2; stir‑fry 45 seconds. Add B3, then B4; boil and reduce ~3 minutes. Return beef; toss until glazed. Cut heat; add Thai basil and garlic; toss to combine.

recipes.title: Simple, Perfect Chili
recipes.instructions: Brown beef in two pressed batches for deep crust; reserve fat. Sweat onions; toast garlic and spices in beef fat, then add tomato sauce and cook to deep red. Deglaze pot with red wine; add beef, onion/spice mix, 3 cups beef broth, beans, and chocolate. Cover and simmer 1 hour, stirring every 15 minutes to lift fond; add more broth as needed. Finish with masa harina slurry, 1/4 tsp MSG, and salt to taste.

recipes.title: Candied Bacon
recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Mix brown sugar, rice vinegar, maple syrup, and black pepper to taste. Arrange thick‑cut bacon on a rack over a sheet pan. Bake 10 minutes, flip and bake 5 more. Brush both sides with glaze and return to oven; continue baking and brushing every 5 minutes until browned and crisp, about 35 minutes total.

recipes.title: Dak Galbi (Korean Spicy Chicken Stir Fry)
recipes.instructions: Mix marinade (gochujang, rice wine, gochugaru, soy sauce, sugar, garlic, ginger, Korean curry powder, grated onion). Toss with chicken; marinate 30 minutes to overnight. Heat large skillet over medium‑high; add oil. Add cabbage, sweet potato, carrot, perilla, and rice cakes; place chicken on top. Cook 3–4 minutes, then reduce to medium/low and stir often until chicken is cooked and vegetables tender, 10–15 minutes. Cover to speed cooking. Serve with rice.

recipes.title: Simple Red Beans and Rice
recipes.instructions: Prep: B1 dice onion and bell pepper; B2 slice sausage; B3 mix tomato paste, minced garlic, and Cajun seasoning; B4 drain and rinse beans. Sauté onion and bell pepper on high until lightly caramelized; remove. Sear sausage in batches; remove. Deglaze hot pan with a splash of cooking wine, add onions/peppers and scrape up fond. Stir in B3; cook until tomato paste toasts and fragrant. Add 1 cup chicken stock; stir until smooth and deglazed. Transfer to pot; add remaining stock, beans, sausage, hot sauce, and bay leaf. Cover and simmer 15 minutes. Uncover, season with salt/black pepper/MSG to taste, and simmer 15 minutes more; mash some beans against the pot wall to thicken if needed. Serve over rice.

recipes.title: Korean Pork Sammich
recipes.instructions: Blend marinade: ginger, shallot, asian pear, garlic, gochujang, gochugaru, sesame oil, sweet soy sauce, dark soy sauce, mirin. Toss with sliced pork belly; marinate at least 4 hours or overnight. Quick pickle: thinly slice daikon, cucumber, carrot, and serrano; toss with sugar, salt, and rice vinegar; rest 15 minutes. Cook pork on a rack-lined sheet at 450F (230C) for 15–20 minutes until browned edges. Toast buns. Spread Kewpie mayo, pile on pork and salad, and serve.

recipes.title: Pulled Pork
recipes.instructions: Pork: Cube pork shoulder and sear in batches. Combine chilies, Dr Pepper, Worcestershire, apple cider vinegar, liquid smoke, all spices, and orange zest; add pork and cook in slow cooker on LOW 8–12 hours. Remove pork, shred, return to cooker 20 minutes on LOW. Strain juices; add ~1/2 cup back and stir in BBQ sauce; season to taste. Coleslaw: Mix shredded cabbages, carrots, and green onions. In a separate bowl whisk mayo, sour cream, vinegar, sugar, Dijon, lemon juice, salt, dill, and pepper. Toss slaw with dressing as needed just before serving.

recipes.title: Chinese Seared Chicken Thighs
recipes.instructions: Prep bowls: B1 chicken thighs (deboned). B2 marinade (oyster sauce, soy sauce, shaoxing wine, salt, sugar, white pepper, cornstarch, minced ginger). B3 sliced onions (red, white). B4 minced garlic. B5 cornstarch for coating. Pat chicken very dry; marinate 10+ minutes, meat side down first. Lightly coat in cornstarch just before frying (skin last). Heat stainless pan; add avocado oil; immediately drop to low. Fry skin-side down 2–3 min until golden; slide for even browning. Flip; cook 5–6 min; flip again 1–2 min. Add garlic and onions; splash shaoxing wine; cover 30–40 sec. Finish with garlic salt and MSG to taste.

recipes.title: French Toast
recipes.instructions: Prep: In a bowl, combine eggs, egg yolks, cinnamon, salt, brown sugar, and nutmeg. Whisk in heavy cream and whole milk to form the custard. Cooking: Dunk bread slices a few seconds per side. Heat a pan with butter until bubbling. Toast each side a few minutes until golden.

recipes.title: J‑Fried Chicken
recipes.instructions: Prep aromatic water: leek greens + ginger peels in 3 tbsp water; squeeze to infuse. Add the water to chicken and mix until absorbed. Add sugar, salt, dark soy, sake, splash of mirin; mix to absorb. Add egg; mix until no liquid pools. Add flour and potato starch; mix very well. Fry: Heat peanut oil to 320°F (160°C). Fry chicken until it floats easily (~90s, ~80% cooked). Rest while raising oil to 356°F (180°C). Fry again until bubbles lighten. Teriyaki: Combine soy sauce, mirin, sake, and sugar; simmer, stirring, to a glaze. Optionally thicken with cornstarch slurry. Toss chicken in glaze or serve alongside.

recipes.title: Shrimp Scampi with Angel Hair Pasta
recipes.instructions: Sauce: Heat pan to medium hot. Add sliced shallot; season with salt/pepper. Add grated garlic and 1 tbsp olive oil; cook until shallots brown. Increase heat, add chili flakes. Add halved cherry tomatoes; reduce heat when simmering; cook until blistered and broken down. Deglaze with white wine; turn up heat and reduce. Add seafood stock and reduce. Add basil; cook ~30 seconds; remove from heat. Shrimp: Season shrimp with salt and pepper. Sear one side 90 seconds; flip and remove from heat. Pasta: Boil angel hair ~90 seconds. Finish: Add pasta to sauce with some pasta water as needed; add shrimp, butter, and parmesan; toss to coat. Zest lemon over the top and adjust seasoning.

recipes.title: Pork and Peppers
recipes.instructions: Peppers: Heat pan on high with a little olive oil. Add sliced red onion and red bell pepper; season with salt and black pepper. Add 1 tbsp sugar; sauté vigorously, keeping the sizzle. When caramelized, add red wine vinegar; add 2 tbsp olive oil and stew 2–3 minutes. Chop basil and stir in; cook ~30 seconds, remove from heat. Pork: Season pork chops with salt and black pepper. Crush a few garlic cloves. Sear pork on one side; add butter, garlic, and thyme. Sear the second side; finish in a 350°F (175°C) oven about 10 minutes or until done. Serve pork with peppers.

recipes.title: Fried Rice
recipes.instructions: Fry Shallots: Add 3 cups peanut oil to wok, add 3 thinly sliced shallots to cold oil. Stir constantly; as soon as browned and bubbling slows, remove and salt immediately. Fried Rice Sauce: Mix grated galangal, sesame oil, Malaysian sambal, 3 cloves finely chopped garlic, sweet soy sauce, and double-aged soy sauce. Cooking: Heat wok; add duck fat. Fry thinly sliced garlic until golden; remove or keep. Add diced shallot, diced fresno chiles, and sliced green onion; stir-fry until soft and fragrant. Push aside; add beaten eggs with a pinch of salt; let set, then stir gently to keep curds. Add cold cooked rice; toss and fry until hot with some crispy bits. Season with ground white pepper and MSG; cut heat. Add fried rice sauce; toss to combine fully. Top with fried shallots.

recipes.title: Teriyaki Sauce for J‑Fried Chicken (Karaage)
recipes.instructions: Combine soy sauce, mirin, sake, and sugar with cornstarch in a small saucepan over medium heat. Whisk constantly until thickened and glossy. Use warm to glaze fried chicken or serve alongside.

recipes.title: Pork Curry Katsu
recipes.instructions: Pickled Cabbage: Slice red cabbage thin. Bring rice vinegar, water, sugar, and salt to a boil; cut heat; stir in yukari. Pour over cabbage in a jar, weight to submerge, cool, then refrigerate. Pork Prep: Score fat and lightly cross-hatch meat; pound to ~1/2 inch; season with salt. Curry Sauce: Thread 1 – melt butter, add onions; cook 30–45 minutes, adjusting heat, until deeply caramelized (add a splash of water if needed). Thread 2 – bring chicken stock to a boil; add dried shiitake to hydrate, then reserve mushrooms. When onions are ready, add grated apple, tomato paste, and rehydrated mushrooms; saute 3–5 minutes. In same pot add butter, melt; whisk in flour; add garam masala, curry powder, and MSG; toast 1 minute. Stir in onion mixture, dark soy, Worcestershire, honey, and chicken stock; simmer and thicken ~2 minutes; salt to taste. Blend very smooth; while blending, add butter in small pieces; strain back to pot and keep warm. Steam Veg: Steam small carrot and potato pieces until tender. Fry Pork: Heat oil to 340°F (170°C). Dredge pork: flour, beaten eggs, then panko. Fry 4–6 minutes until golden and cooked through. Assembly: Bowl rice, add a pocket of curry, slice pork and serve with pickled cabbage on the side.

recipes.title: Sweet and Spicy Baked Honey Sriracha Chicken
recipes.instructions: Chicken: Dredge chicken pieces in flour, then beaten egg, then panko to coat thoroughly. Sauce: Heat peanut oil in a small saucepan; add minced garlic briefly. Whisk in soy sauce, honey, sriracha, water, and red pepper flakes; cook over high heat, whisking, until thickened; set aside. Cooking: Bake breaded chicken about 15 minutes until cooked through, then toss immediately with sauce. Serve with rice.

recipes.title: Miso Soup (Jar Meal Prep)
recipes.instructions: Meal prep 4 jars. For each jar: 1) Add 1.5 tbsp red miso. 2) Add 1 tsp dashi powder. 3) Add tofu. 4) Add spinach. 5) Add shredded carrots. 6) Add green onion. 7) Add wakame. 8) Add vermicelli noodles. Store in fridge until ready. To serve: Bring the jar to room temp, pour in boiling water, and let sit 10 minutes before eating.

recipes.title: Fudge Brownies
recipes.instructions: Melt butter and chocolate over very low heat until smooth; cool 5-10 minutes. Whisk sugar, eggs, and yolk 1-2 minutes until slightly pale. Stream in cooled chocolate-butter while whisking until glossy. Whisk flour, baking powder, and salt separately (optional: swap 1 tbsp flour for 1 tbsp cornstarch; espresso powder optional). Fold dry into wet just until combined. Fold in chopped dark chocolate (optional). Line or grease 8x8 metal pan; spread batter; sprinkle flaky salt if desired. Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 25-27 minutes until a toothpick 1 inch from edge has moist crumbs. Cool at least 1 hour before slicing.

recipes.title: 3-Ingredient Peanut Butter Cookies
recipes.instructions: Adjust oven rack to middle position. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line two rimmed baking sheets with parchment paper. Stir together peanut butter, sugar, and egg in a medium mixing bowl. Allow dough to stand for 10 minutes. Drop dough, about one tablespoon each, onto prepared baking sheets. Lightly press tops of cookies with tines of a fork, making a crosshatch pattern. Sprinkle lightly with granulated sugar, optional. Bake cookies until golden brown, about 12 minutes. Allow cookies to cool on the pan for five minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool fully. Store, wrapped, on the counter, for up to four days.

recipes.title: Yukon Gold Mashed Potatoes (Herb-Infused)
recipes.instructions: Step 1: Place potatoes in a large pot and cover by 1 inch with cold water. Salt the water generously (it should taste briny). Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are very tender but not crumbly, 30–35 minutes. Drain, briefly rinse with cool water, and return to the warm pot off heat to dry while you heat the milk mixture. Step 2: Warm milk, cream, halved garlic head, and rosemary sprigs in a small saucepan over medium until fragrant, about 5 minutes; remove from heat. Step 3: Pass hot potatoes through a ricer or food mill into a large bowl. Add butter and kosher salt and stir until butter is fully incorporated. Strain the warm milk mixture; add to potatoes 1/2 cup at a time, stirring until smooth before adding more. Step 4: Serve topped with freshly ground black pepper. Do ahead: Chill up to 1 day; reheat gently, stirring often and adding 1/4 cup milk or stock to thin if needed.

recipes.title: Juicy American Hamburgers
recipes.instructions: Preheat grill to high heat. Mix ground beef, beaten egg, bread crumbs, evaporated milk, Worcestershire sauce, cayenne, and minced garlic in a large bowl by hand. Form into 8 patties. Lightly oil the grill grates. Grill patties until browned and no longer pink, about 5 minutes per side. Serve hot.

recipes.title: Best Protein Shake
recipes.instructions: Add milk to blender, then peanut butter, Greek yogurt, protein powder, frozen strawberries, banana, a pinch of salt, chia seeds, and creatine. Blend on high until very smooth, 45–60 seconds, scraping sides if needed. Adjust sweetness or thickness with honey or more milk if desired. Serve immediately.
